page.title: 19The Water Tower at Trimley
page.content: The water tower has been here since 1930 and holds up to{3,000,000 gallons of water which come from the reservoirs at{Bucklesham}and Alton Waters.It travels along pipes until it reaches the tower and pressure pumps it to the top where it is stored until it's ready to be used.The Water tower is{132ft}high and built of steel covered in concrete.It must be taller than every building in the area to provide enough pressure to pump it to the top. The tower has once gone dry because salt water got in and they had to drain it out. The tower was built in Trimley St.Mary because it is the most level part and now is owned by {The Anglian Water Authority.}The tower is painted red and white which makes it a landmark for ships out in the North Sea.{Trinity House}requested a flood warning system on the roof.
